prompt:
A chat between a curious user and an artificial intelligence assistant. The assistant gives helpful, detailed, and polite answers to the user's questions. USER: Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Selenium web driver | java | unable to switch between firefox browser windows: :Using Selenium Webdriver 2. java.I would like to switch back in forth between two firefox browser windows. When I do I get: org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchWindoException: Unable to loacate window"{accb1cc2-74c9-3b4e-8f71-c0b184a037c4}"; duration or timeout: Here is the java:driver = new FirefoxDriver();driver.get("http://mail.google.com");String firstWindowHandle = driver.getWindowHandle();System.out.println("handle of first window ="+firstWindowHandle);Thread.sleep(1000);driver = new FirefoxDriver();driver.get("http://www.google.com");// Get names of currently open windowsString secondWindowHandle = driver.getWindowHandle();System.out.println("handle of first window ="+secondWindowHandle);Thread.sleep(1000);// It fails right here!driver.switchTo().window(firstWindowHandle );driver.get("http://www.lifehacker.com");It prints the following to the console:- handle of first window = {accb1cc2-74c9-3b4e-8f71-c0b184a037c4}- handle of the second window = {f5256619-a36e-a441-9979-937da0abacd1}All help is appreciated.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: WebElement element = driver.findElement(By.id("search-btn"));
String windowHandle = (String) element.getAttribute("data-window-handle");
Iterator<String> windowHandles = driver.getWindowHandles();
while (windowHandles.hasNext()) {
String currentHandle = windowHandles.next();
if (currentHandle.equals(windowHandle)) {
driver.switchTo().window(windowHandle);
break;
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: The getAttribute() method returns the value of the specified attribute of the element. The data-window-handle attribute is used to store the handle of the current window. The Iterator.next() method is used to iterate over the windowHandles and check if the current handle matches the windowHandle. If it does, the switchTo().window() method is used to switch to the current window.
